DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : White blood cell donor expose cytomegalovirus may able help prevent infection occur patient undergo bone marrow peripheral stem cell transplantation . PURPOSE : Phase II trial study effectiveness donate white blood cell prevent cytomegalovirus infection patient undergo bone marrow peripheral stem cell transplantation .
DOC.brief_title: Immunotherapy Treating Patients Who Are Undergoing Bone Marrow Peripheral Stem Cell Transplantation
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Determine whether adoptive immunotherapy comprise donor-derived CD8+ , CMV-specific , major histocompatibility complex class I-restricted cytotoxic T-lymphocyte ( CTL ) clone ( CD8+ CMV-specific CTL clone ) CD4+ CMV-specific T-helper ( Th ) -cell clone effective prevent CMV viremia disease CMV-positive patient malignancy require allogeneic bone marrow peripheral blood stem cell transplantation . II . Determine whether transfer CD4+ CMV-specific Th-cell clone patient deficient response reconstitute CD4+ Th-cell activity augment adoptively transfer CD8+ CMV-specific CTL clone . OUTLINE : Allogeneic CD8+ CMV-specific , major histocompatibility complex class I-restricted cytotoxic T-lymphocyte ( CTL ) clone ( CD8+ CMV-specific CTL clone ) CD4+ CMV-specific T-helper ( Th ) -cell clone harvest cultured vitro least 2 week bone marrow peripheral blood stem cell ( PBSC ) transplantation . Bone marrow PBSC infuse day 0 . Patients receive first infusion CD8+ CMV-specific CTL clone begin day 28 45 posttransplantation , follow 8 day later second infusion , follow 2 day later first infusion CD4+ CMV-specific Th-cell clone . Patients receive prednisone posttransplantation deficient CD8+ CTL response ( i.e. , less 50 % response measure immunocompetent bone marrow donor ) second infusion CD8+ CMV-specific CTL clone receive third infusion CD8+ CMV-specific CTL clone second infusion CD4+ CMV-specific Th-cell clone day 67 . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 30 patient accrue study within 12-18 month .
